name: SetSeriesSettings
description: Utility service to easily set all of the settings required for enabling ATCUD in Portugal (SAFT)

properties.name: ClientCertificate
properties.description: Certificate that was generated by combining the private key with the key received from AT

properties.name: ClientCertificatePassword
properties.description: Recommended, password to the client certificate

properties.name: Endpoint
properties.description: Endpoint to connect to when registering series. Use https://servicos.portaldasfinancas.gov.pt:722/SeriesWSService for TEST and https://servicos.portaldasfinancas.gov.pt:422/SeriesWSService for PRODUCTION

properties.name: OrganizationUnitID
properties.description: Organization unit to which the settings should be applied

properties.name: Password
properties.description: Password of the web service user

properties.name: SigningCertificate
properties.description: Certificate that was handed out by the AT after completing the CSR steps (.cer file)

properties.name: Username
properties.description: Username of the web service user created in the AT portal with at least WSE rights

properties.name: Code
properties.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

properties.name: RequestID
properties.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: A short description of the error type.

properties.name: ExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

properties.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
properties.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

properties.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
properties.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
